info.title: AgentAPI Proxy
info.description: API for managing agent sessions, schedules, and settings. AgentAPI Proxy provides a unified interface for running AI agents with Kubernetes-based session management.

get.description: Returns the health status of the proxy server.

post.description: Creates a new session and starts an agentapi server instance. Returns the session ID for subsequent requests.

get.description: Returns a list of sessions. Non-admin users can see their own sessions and team-scoped sessions they have access to. Supports filtering by status, scope, team, and tags.

delete.description: Terminates and deletes a session. Users can only delete their own sessions.

403.description: Forbidden - can only delete own sessions

post.description: Creates a shareable URL for the session. Only the session owner can create a share URL.

403.description: Forbidden - only session owner can create share URL

get.description: Returns the share status for a session. Only the session owner can view the share status.

403.description: Forbidden - only session owner can view share status

delete.description: Revokes/deletes the share URL for a session. Only the session owner can revoke the share.

403.description: Forbidden - only session owner can revoke share URL

/s/{shareToken}/{path}.description: All GET/HEAD requests to /s/{shareToken}/* are proxied to the corresponding agentapi server instance in read-only mode.

get.description: Proxy GET request to a shared session. Only GET and HEAD methods are allowed for shared sessions.

403.description: Shared sessions are read-only (POST/PUT/DELETE not allowed)

404.description: Invalid share token or session not found

head.description: Proxy HEAD request to a shared session.

404.description: Invalid share token or session not found

/{sessionId}/{path}.description: All requests to /{sessionId}/* are proxied to the corresponding agentapi server instance.

403.description: Forbidden - can only access own sessions

requestBody.description: Request body to forward to agentapi

403.description: Forbidden - can only access own sessions

post.description: Creates a new schedule for delayed or recurring session execution.

get.description: Returns a list of schedules. Non-admin users can see their own schedules and team-scoped schedules they have access to.
Returns a specific schedule by ID.

403.description: Forbidden - can only access own schedules
Forbidden - can only update own schedules
Forbidden - can only delete own schedules

post.description: Immediately executes a schedule, creating a new session.

403.description: Forbidden - can only trigger own schedules

post.description: Creates a new webhook configuration for receiving GitHub events.

get.description: Returns a list of webhooks. Non-admin users can see their own webhooks and team-scoped webhooks they have access to.
Returns a specific webhook by ID.

403.description: Forbidden - can only access own webhooks
Forbidden - can only update own webhooks
Forbidden - can only delete own webhooks

post.description: Generates a new secret for signature verification.
Receives webhook payloads from GitHub/GHES. Uses the webhook ID from the URL to identify the webhook and verifies the signature using the webhook's secret.

get.description: Returns settings for a user or team. Users can access their own settings or settings of teams they belong to.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Settings name (user ID or team name like 'org-team')

put.description: Creates or updates settings for a user or team. Users can modify their own settings or team settings if they have admin/maintainer role.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Settings name (user ID or team name like 'org-team')

delete.description: Deletes settings for a user or team. Also deletes associated credentials and MCP servers secrets.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Settings name (user ID or team name like 'org-team')

get.description: Returns information about the currently authenticated user.

post.description: Registers a Web Push subscription for receiving notifications.

get.description: Returns the current user's push notification subscriptions.

endpoint.description: The push subscription endpoint to unsubscribe

get.description: Returns the history of notifications for the current user.

tags.description: Tags for the session (e.g., repository, branch)

scope.description: Ownership scope of the session (default: user)

message.description: Initial message to send to the agent after session starts

github_token.description: GitHub token to use for authentication instead of GitHub App

scope.description: Ownership scope of the schedule (default: user)

scheduled_at.description: When to execute (ISO8601). Either scheduled_at or cron_expr must be set.

execution_count.description: Number of times the schedule has been executed

session_id.description: ID of the created session (if successful)

scope.description: Ownership scope of the webhook (default: user)

webhook_url.description: URL to configure in GitHub/external service

enterprise_url.description: GitHub Enterprise Server URL (empty for github.com)

allowed_events.description: List of allowed GitHub events (empty = all)

initial_message_template.description: Go template for initial message (e.g., 'Review PR #{{.pull_request.Number}}')

github_token.description: GitHub token for the session (used in requests only)

initial_message_template.description: Go template for initial message (e.g., 'Review PR #{{.pull_request.Number}}')

WebhookSessionConfigResponse.description: Session configuration in responses (sensitive params like github_token are excluded)

ResourceScope.description: Ownership scope. 'user' for personal resources, 'team' for team-shared resources

mcp_servers.description: MCP server configurations keyed by server name

marketplaces.description: Claude Code plugin marketplace configurations keyed by marketplace name

claude_code_oauth_token.description: Claude Code OAuth token for authentication. Set to empty string to remove.

auth_mode.description: Authentication mode. If not set, oauth is preferred when both credentials are available.

enabled_plugins.description: List of enabled plugins in 'plugin@marketplace' format (e.g., 'commit@claude-plugins-official')

url.description: Git repository URL of the marketplace

name.description: Settings name (user ID or team name)

has_claude_code_oauth_token.description: Whether a Claude Code OAuth token is configured

auth_mode.description: The determined authentication mode being used

enabled_plugins.description: List of enabled plugins in 'plugin@marketplace' format

env_keys.description: List of environment variable keys (values are not returned)

header_keys.description: List of header keys (values are not returned)

url.description: Git repository URL of the marketplace

share_url.description: Relative URL for accessing the shared session (e.g., /s/{token}/)

expires_at.description: When the share expires (null if no expiration)

share_url.description: Relative URL for accessing the shared session

created_by.description: User ID who created the share

expires_at.description: When the share expires (null if no expiration)

tags.name: Session Proxy
tags.description: Proxy requests to agentapi server instances

tags.name: Session Sharing
tags.description: Session sharing for read-only access via shareable URLs

tags.name: Schedules
tags.description: Schedule management for delayed and recurring session execution

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: Webhook management for receiving GitHub events and triggering sessions

tags.name: Settings
tags.description: User and team settings management including Bedrock, MCP servers, and Claude Code plugin marketplaces
